alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN LINCOLN, SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE AND EASTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM MDT... At 256 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Vaughn, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Lincoln, southwestern Guadalupe and eastern Torrance Counties. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 187 and 202. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 279 and 281. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County
